title: Sampler, early 19th century
medium:
Medium: silk embroidery, wool foundation
Technique: cross and stem stitches on plain weave
signed:
embroidered signature
"Eliza Townley finished Dec.m 9th aged 11 years"
"Catholic School, Congleton"
inscribed:
embroidered text
"Lord as through life's perplexing maze I stray
 Be thou the guiding star to mark my way
 Conduct the steps of my unguarded youth
 And point their motion to the paths of truth"
provenance: ex. coll. Mrs. Henry E. Coe (Eva Johnston Coe)
creditline: Bequest of Mrs. Henry E. Coe
description: Verse, tree, stags, basket of flowers and detached motifs.

tombstone.epitaph:
Sampler, early 19th century.
early 19th century. Medium: silk embroidery, wool foundation
Technique: cross and stem stitches on plain weave. Bequest of Mrs. Henry E. Coe. 1941-69-87.
